Package tage

Class HUDmanager

java.lang.Object
tage.HUDmanager
public class HUDmanager extends Object
Manages strings, implemented as GLUT strings. This class is instantiated automatically by the engine. Note that this class utilizes deprectated OpenGL functionality.

The available fonts are:

  • GLUT.BITMAP_8_BY_13
  • GLUT.BITMAP_9_BY_15
  • GLUT.BITMAP_TIMES_ROMAN_10
  • GLUT.BITMAP_TIMES_ROMAN_24
  • GLUT.BITMAP_HELVETICA_10
  • GLUT.BITMAP_HELVETICA_12
  • GLUT.BITMAP_HELVETICA_18

Baseline colors for HUD text

  • red
  • green
  • blue
  • purple
  • yellow
  • teal
  • white
  • black
Author:
Scott Gordon, extended by Aaron Goodlund

  • Method Details

    • addHUDElement

      public int addHUDElement(String name, org.joml.Vector3f color, int x, int y)
      add a HUD element to the list reading name in designated color at window pixel position (x,y). Returns the element's index for later updating

    • addHudElement

    • removeHUDElement

      public void removeHUDElement(int index)
      Remove the hud element at the designated index. This has the potential of throwing off HUD calls if you trim the list to remove the empty spaces
